edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Obstacle

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.PhysicsSprite
      • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Obstacle

  • public class Obstacle
extends PhysicsSprite
    Obstacles are usually walls, except they can move, and can be used to run all sorts of abritrary code that changes the game, or the behavior of the things that collide with them

    • Constructor Detail

      • Obstacle

        protected Obstacle(float width,
        float height,
        java.lang.String imgName)
        Internal constructor to build an Obstacle. This should never be invoked directly. Instead, use the 'addXXX' methods of the Object class.
        Parameters:
        width - width of this Obstacle
        height - height of this Obstacle
        imgName - Name of the image file to use

    • Method Detail

      • makeAsBox

        public static Obstacle makeAsBox(float x,
                 float y,
                 float width,
                 float height,
                 java.lang.String imgName)
        Draw an obstacle with an underlying box shape
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the bottom left corner
        y - Y coordinate of the bottom left corner
        width - Width of the obstacle
        height - Height of the obstacle
        imgName - Name of image file to use
        Returns:
        The obstacle, so that it can be further modified

      • makeAsPolygon

        public static Obstacle makeAsPolygon(float x,
                     float y,
                     float width,
                     float height,
                     java.lang.String imgName,
                     float... verts)
        Draw an obstacle with an underlying polygon shape
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the bottom left corner
        y - Y coordinate of the bottom left corner
        width - Width of the obstacle
        height - Height of the obstacle
        imgName - Name of image file to use
        vertices - Up to 16 coordinates representing the vertexes of this polygon, listed as x0,y0,x1,y1,x2,y2,...
        Returns:
        The obstacle, so that it can be further modified

        width - Width of the obstacle
        height - Height of the obstacle
        imgName - Name of image file to use
        Returns:

      • setDamp

        public void setDamp(float factor)
        Call this on an Obstacle to give it a dampening factor. A hero can glide over damp Obstacles. Damp factors can be negative to cause a reverse direction, less than 1 to cause a slowdown (friction pads), or greater than 1 to serve as zoom pads.
        Parameters:
        factor - Value to multiply the hero's velocity when it collides with this Obstacle

      • setSpeedBoost

        public void setSpeedBoost(float boostAmountX,
                 float boostAmountY,
                 float boostDuration)
        Call this on an event to make it behave like a "damp" obstacle, except with a constant additive (or subtractive) effect on the hero's speed.
        Parameters:
        boostAmountX - The amount to add to the hero's X velocity
        boostAmountY - The amount to add to the hero's Y velocity
        boostDuration - How long should the speed boost last (use -1 to indicate "forever")

      • setReJump

        public void setReJump(boolean enable)
        Control whether the hero can jump if it collides with this obstacle while in the air
        Parameters:
        enable - true if the hero can jump again, false otherwise

      • setHeroCollisionTrigger

        public void setHeroCollisionTrigger(int id,
                           int activationGoodies1,
                           int activationGoodies2,
                           int activationGoodies3,
                           int activationGoodies4,
                           float delay)
        Make the object a trigger object, so that custom code will run when a hero collides with it
        Parameters:
        id - identifier for the trigger
        activationGoodies1 - Number of type-1 goodies that must be collected before this trigger works
        activationGoodies2 - Number of type-2 goodies that must be collected before this trigger works
        activationGoodies3 - Number of type-3 goodies that must be collected before this trigger works
        activationGoodies4 - Number of type-4 goodies that must be collected before this trigger works
        delay - The time between when the collision happens, and when the trigger code runs. Use 0 for immediately

      • setEnemyCollisionTrigger

        public void setEnemyCollisionTrigger(int id,
                            int activationGoodies1,
                            int activationGoodies2,
                            int activationGoodies3,
                            int activationGoodies4,
                            float delay)
        Make the object a trigger object, so that custom code will run when an enemy collides with it
        Parameters:
        id - identifier for the trigger
        activationGoodies1 - Number of type-1 goodies that must be collected before this trigger works
        activationGoodies2 - Number of type-2 goodies that must be collected before this trigger works
        activationGoodies3 - Number of type-3 goodies that must be collected before this trigger works
        activationGoodies4 - Number of type-4 goodies that must be collected before this trigger works
        delay - The time between when the collision happens, and when the trigger code runs. Use 0 for immediately

      • setProjectileCollisionTrigger

                                 int activationGoodies1,
                                 int activationGoodies2,
                                 int activationGoodies3,
                                 int activationGoodies4)

        Parameters:

        activationGoodies1 - Number of type-1 goodies that must be collected before this trigger works
        activationGoodies2 - Number of type-2 goodies that must be collected before this trigger works

        activationGoodies4 - Number of type-4 goodies that must be collected before this trigger works

      • setCollideSound

        public void setCollideSound(java.lang.String sound,
                   long delay)
        Indicate that when the hero collides with this obstacle, we should make a sound
        Parameters:
        sound - The name of the sound file to play
        delay - How long to wait before playing the sound again, in milliseconds
